basics.name: Robert Douglas
basics.label: Senior Frontend Developer / Design Engineer
basics.summary: Developer / designer with 20+ years experience in web and mobile, I combine my full-stack engineering and UX expertise to develop solid, user-centred product solutions. I'm known for being passionate, collaborative, supportive, and calm under pressure. I care deeply about product and people, quality and clarity.
basics.future: Prior to Welcome to the Jungle, I led the Design & UX team at Rightmove (UK's largest property website), was a 'multidisciplinaire' at ribot (mobile design studio), and (remotely) led a cross-functional team at a VR startup in London. I'm looking for a role where I can put my T-shaped skills to good use, working with great people on interesting problems.

work.name: Welcome to the Jungle
highlights: Implemented new features and evolution of B2C site with React / Redux / Webpack / Cypress
Led Core Web Vitals monitoring and improvements (TTFB -70%, LCP -50%, CLS 0.02s)
Implemented Cloudfront caching to improve performance and cut server costs (~30% cache hit rate)
Led front-end code coverage initiatives, increasing coverage by ~25%
Collaborated closely with Data / QA / Support teams to standardise best practices
Improved and built on B2B apps with React / Typescript / Valtio / TanStack Query
Set up and key contributions to component library inc. codemod for styled-components to Tailwind migration

work.name: Pupil
highlights: Managed frontend developers and maintained tech stack decisions
Delivered and iterated on React/Redux application
Ensured code consistency and quality across team

work.name: anu creative
work.summary: Freelance designer / developer for web / mobile
highlights: tutor house: Wireframing, visual design, front-end responsive build, analytics
Bastion: Development of cross-platform mobile app (React Native) and Ruby on Rails CMS

work.name: ribot
highlights: Pitches, user research, design, development and internal project management across many projects
Design (and some development) on Tesco's first mobile apps (Nokia, iPhone, iPad, Windows Phone, Chrome)
Designed and developed Intel proof-of-concepts and prototypes on iPad
Developed mobile and web prototypes for diverse client base
Mentored team members in professional development

work.name: Rightmove
work.position: Team Lead: Design, UX and Front-end Development
highlights: Grew and led the Design & UX team
Led the design and front-end development through a full site redesign
Set up a User-Centred Design framework including usability testing and user research pool
Prototyped and user-tested various revenue-generating initiatives
Instigated and defined annual hack-days

work.name: Charity e-cards
work.summary: Design and development of shopping site for digital charity greeting cards

work.name: Hit Studios
work.summary: Design, full-stack development, print design, mobile development (!)

volunteer.summary: Teaching, sexual health education and event management
highlights: Volunteer on the Sexual Health Education Program: teaching secondary school children (and the community) about HIV/AIDS and other STIs in Tanzania.

projects.name: anucreative website
projects.description: Personal portfolio and CV website built with React, TanStack Router, and deployed on Netlify.
highlights: Multi-theme support with CSS variables
JSON Resume schema integration
Performance optimized (100 Lighthouse score)
Open source monorepo structure
